system.biography:
TitleFFF 115-2 Mercenary MF
Birthday8 Halane 680
AppearanceAge 39, height 6’ 2”, medium frame, weight 180 lb, attractive appearance, medium complexion, brown hair, blue eyes
Medical/PsycheNone
Size7
ArmorCloth tunic and leggings, long brown oiled-canvas coat, leather calf boots and gloves, ring vest, broadsword, and dagger, plus round shield, half-helm and spear when combat is expected
Other EquipmentBelt pouch
Valuables189d in silver in a money pouch
NotesShâ’s ship is available for download at http://www.lythia.com/game_aides/64-foot-dak/

Biography

Eshârel (Shâ for short) is a Jarin from Arone. His father died when he was young. His mother, a cattle herder, raised him alone. In 700TR, while Shâ was out tending cattle, Jarin rebels raided Arone, killing two huscarls. In retribution, the Ivinians hung twenty Jarin peasants, including his mother. Nursing a burning desire for revenge, Shâ fled into the wilderness and joined the rebels. There, he met Zoë, beginning a life long friendship.

Shâ rose quickly among the rebels. His natural leadership ability got him promoted to sergeant, with Zoë as his corporal. In 701TR, he helped plan and lead the liberation of Lorkin Castle. From 701-703TR, the ‘Independent Years,’ he fought against the hated Ivinians. In 703TR, the Jarin leader, Gweffryn Seylnes, was mysteriously decapitated. Shâ held the men together for two more weeks before the castle fell to Clan Geldestaar. Shâ and Zoë slipped over the wall and across the Anoth River.

A witty, bitter and angry man, Shâ lost more than the war; he lost his sense of compassion and forgiveness and all faith in the Jarin lords and Siem. There are now very few people he trusts. Shâ relations with Ivinians are hostile at best. Shâ bristles at the term Orbaal, referring to i as Occupied Jara and its overlords as Ivinians.

After the defeat at Lorkin, Shâ and Zoë crossed over to Lythia, fighting as mercenaries for Trierzon against Shorkyne. In 713TR, on the Plains of Karetan, Shâ ad the captured Baron of Suvas, Sir Dasen Queridona a wealthy liegeman of Clan Pelanby. He ransomed him for £120. Shâ poured the ransom and the remains of his heart and soul into the purchase of a dilapidated dak, renaming her Lorkin. With the minimum repairs he set sail, free at last.

In addition to legitimate transport runs, Shâ engages in what he likes to call “perfectly legitimate entrepreneurial endeavors”. No job is too big, too small, or too illegal, as long as it keeps his crew together and his ship sailing. Captain Ranals is very protective of his crew and lives by a very strong moral code centred on his word, his loyalty to his crew and an inconvenient sense of charity.

Adventure Hooks

Avoid Any Ivinian Entanglements. The PCs need transportation. Shâ’s ship is heading in the right directio He is willing to take them…for a price.

Special Order. The PCs need a special item, which is not available due to the Melderyni Blockade. An underworld contact suggests Shâ might be able to help them.

Old War Buddy. PCs involved in a second Jarin Rebellion might want to call on their old war buddy, Shâ, for weapons and discrete delivery of supplies.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
